get.summary: Retreives a list of App objects

parameters.name: O.name
parameters.description: Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.

parameters.name: O.tenant
parameters.description:
Tenant is global namespace isolation for various objects. This can be automatically
filled in many cases based on the tenant a user, who created the object, belongs go.

parameters.name: O.namespace
parameters.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

parameters.name: O.resource-version
parameters.description: Resource version in the object store. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: O.uuid
parameters.description: UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: O.creation-time
parameters.description: CreationTime is the creation time of Object.

parameters.name: O.mod-time
parameters.description: ModTime is the Last Modification time of Object.

parameters.name: O.self-link
parameters.description:
SelfLink is a link to accessing this object. When stored in the KV store this is
 the key in the kvstore and when the object is served from the API-GW it is the
 URI path. Examples
   - "/venice/tenants/tenants/tenant2" in the kvstore
   - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" when served by API Gateway.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
from represents the start offset (zero based), used for pagination.
results returned would be in the range [from ... from+max-results-1].

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: max. number of events to be fetched for the request.

parameters.name: T.kind
parameters.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

parameters.name: T.api-version
parameters.description: APIVersion defines the version of the API object.

parameters.name: meta.tenant
parameters.description:
Tenant is global namespace isolation for various objects. This can be automatically
filled in many cases based on the tenant a user, who created the object, belongs go.

parameters.name: meta.namespace
parameters.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

parameters.name: meta.resource-version
parameters.description: Resource version in the object store. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: meta.uuid
parameters.description: UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: meta.creation-time
parameters.description: CreationTime is the creation time of Object.

parameters.name: meta.mod-time
parameters.description: ModTime is the Last Modification time of Object.

parameters.name: meta.self-link
parameters.description:
SelfLink is a link to accessing this object. When stored in the KV store this is
 the key in the kvstore and when the object is served from the API-GW it is the
 URI path. Examples
   - "/venice/tenants/tenants/tenant2" in the kvstore
   - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" when served by API Gateway.

parameters.name: status.description
parameters.description:
Name is already part of meta
Description of app - example “mongo https://www.mongodb.com/”.

get.summary: Retreives a list of Certificate objects

parameters.name: O.name
parameters.description: Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.

parameters.name: O.namespace
parameters.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

parameters.name: O.resource-version
parameters.description: Resource version in the object store. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: O.uuid
parameters.description: UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: O.creation-time
parameters.description: CreationTime is the creation time of Object.

parameters.name: O.mod-time
parameters.description: ModTime is the Last Modification time of Object.

parameters.name: O.self-link
parameters.description:
SelfLink is a link to accessing this object. When stored in the KV store this is
 the key in the kvstore and when the object is served from the API-GW it is the
 URI path. Examples
   - "/venice/tenants/tenants/tenant2" in the kvstore
   - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" when served by API Gateway.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
from represents the start offset (zero based), used for pagination.
results returned would be in the range [from ... from+max-results-1].

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: max. number of events to be fetched for the request.

parameters.name: T.kind
parameters.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

parameters.name: T.api-version
parameters.description: APIVersion defines the version of the API object.

parameters.name: meta.namespace
parameters.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

parameters.name: meta.resource-version
parameters.description: Resource version in the object store. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: meta.uuid
parameters.description: UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: meta.creation-time
parameters.description: CreationTime is the creation time of Object.

parameters.name: meta.mod-time
parameters.description: ModTime is the Last Modification time of Object.

parameters.name: meta.self-link
parameters.description:
SelfLink is a link to accessing this object. When stored in the KV store this is
 the key in the kvstore and when the object is served from the API-GW it is the
 URI path. Examples
   - "/venice/tenants/tenants/tenant2" in the kvstore
   - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" when served by API Gateway.

parameters.name: spec.description
parameters.description: Description of the purpose of this certificate.

parameters.name: spec.usages
parameters.description:
Usage can be "client", "server" or "trust-root" in any combination.
A "server" certificate is used by a server to authenticate itself to the client
A "client" certificate is used by a client to authenticate itself to a server
A "trust-root" certificate is self-signed and is only used to validate
certificates presented by peers.
"client" and "server" certificates are always accompanied by a private key,
whereas "trust-root"-only certificates are not.

parameters.name: spec.body
parameters.description: Body of the certificate in PEM encoding.

parameters.name: spec.trust-chain
parameters.description:
Trust chain of the certificate in PEM encoding.
These certificates are treated opaquely. We do not process them in any way
other than decoding them for informational purposes.

parameters.name: status.validity
parameters.description:
Status of the certificate: "valid", "invalid", "expired"
"invalid" means that the signature of the certificate does not match or
there are inconsistencies in the trust chain.

parameters.name: status.workloads
parameters.description: The workloads where this certificate has been deployed.

parameters.name: T.kind
parameters.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

parameters.name: T.api-version
parameters.description: APIVersion defines the version of the API object.

parameters.name: meta.namespace
parameters.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

parameters.name: meta.resource-version
parameters.description: Resource version in the object store. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: meta.uuid
parameters.description: UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: meta.creation-time
parameters.description: CreationTime is the creation time of Object.

parameters.name: meta.mod-time
parameters.description: ModTime is the Last Modification time of Object.

parameters.name: meta.self-link
parameters.description:
SelfLink is a link to accessing this object. When stored in the KV store this is
 the key in the kvstore and when the object is served from the API-GW it is the
 URI path. Examples
   - "/venice/tenants/tenants/tenant2" in the kvstore
   - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" when served by API Gateway.

parameters.name: spec.mode
parameters.description: Possible values: TLS, IPsec.

parameters.name: tls.version
parameters.description: TLS version: only supported value at present is 1.2.

parameters.name: tls.cipher-suite
parameters.description:
The name of the cipher suite in IANA format
default is TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384.

parameters.name: ipsec.encryption-transform
parameters.description: ESP encryption algorithm. Default is "aes-256-gcm-128" (See RFC4106).

parameters.name: ipsec.integrity-transform
parameters.description:
ESP integrity algorithm.
Default is "NULL" (must be "NULL" if AES-GCM is used for encryption).

parameters.name: spec.key-rotation-interval-secs
parameters.description: How often the keys should be rotated, in seconds.

resource-version.description: Resource version of object store at the time of list generation.

apiListMeta.description: ListMeta contains the metadata for list of objects.

from.title:
from represents the start offset (zero based), used for pagination.
results returned would be in the range [from ... from+max-results-1]

max-results.description: max. number of events to be fetched for the request.

name.description: Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.

tenant.description:
Tenant is global namespace isolation for various objects. This can be automatically
filled in many cases based on the tenant a user, who created the object, belongs go.

namespace.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

resource-version.description: Resource version in the object store. This can only be set by the server.

uuid.description: UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This can only be set by the server.

labels.description: Labels are arbitrary (key,value) pairs associated with any object.

creation-time.title: CreationTime is the creation time of Object

mod-time.title: ModTime is the Last Modification time of Object

self-link.description:
SelfLink is a link to accessing this object. When stored in the KV store this is
 the key in the kvstore and when the object is served from the API-GW it is the
 URI path. Examples
   - "/venice/tenants/tenants/tenant2" in the kvstore
   - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" when served by API Gateway.

apiObjectMeta.description: ObjectMeta contains metadata that all objects stored in kvstore must have.

namespace.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

kind.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

name.description: Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.

uri.description: URI is a link to accessing the referenced object.

apiObjectRef.description: ObjectRef contains identifying information about an object.

result.description: Result contains the status of the operation, success or failure.

message.description: Message contains human readable form of the error.

code.description: Code is the HTTP status code.

object-ref.description: Reference to the object (optional) for which this status is being sent.

apiStatus.description: Status is returned for calls that dont return objects.

apiStatusResult.description: StatusResult contains possible statuses for a NIC.

kind.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

api-version.description: APIVersion defines the version of the API object.

apiTypeMeta.description: TypeMeta contains the metadata about kind and version for all API objects.

key.description: The label key that the condition applies to.

values.description:
Values contains one or more values corresponding to the label key. "equals" and
"notEquals" operators need a single Value. "in" and "notIn" operators can have
one or more values.

labelsRequirement.description: Requirement defines a single matching condition for a selector.

labelsSelector.description:
Selector is used to select objects by labels. Requirements in the selector are ANDed.
A selector with no Requirements does not select anything.

securityApp.title:
App - Read-only objects auto-created by Venice
One object per App that can be identified by Naples

securityAppList.title: AppList is a container object for list of App objects

securityAppSpec.title: AppSpec - spec part of App object

description.title:
Name is already part of meta
Description of app - example “mongo https://www.mongodb.com/”

securityAppStatus.title: AppStatus - status part of App object

securityAppUser.title:
AppUser is derived from application payload such as database login or
other application authentication mechanisms.
Created by Venice Admin or Tenant Admin

securityAppUserGrp.title:
AppUserGrp - Object representing group of AppUsers
Created by Venice Admin or Tenant Admin

securityAppUserGrpList.title: AppUserGrpList is a container object for list of AppUserGrp objects

description.title: Description of the AppUserGrp - example "SQL Users"

securityAppUserGrpSpec.title: AppUserGrpSpec - spec part of AppUserGrp object

securityAppUserGrpStatus.title: AppUserGrpStatus - status part of AppUserGrp object

securityAppUserList.title: AppUserList is a container object for list of AppUser objects

description.title:
Name is part of the meta
Description of the AppUser - example "cassandra user"

securityAppUserSpec.title: AppUserSpec - spec part of AppUser object

securityAppUserStatus.title: AppUserStatus - status part of AppUser object

securityAutoMsgAppUserGrpWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgAppUserGrpWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for AppUserGrp objects

securityAutoMsgAppUserWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgAppUserWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for AppUser objects

securityAutoMsgAppWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgAppWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for App objects

securityAutoMsgCertificateWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgCertificateWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for Certificate objects

securityAutoMsgSecurityGroupWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgSecurityGroupWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for SecurityGroup objects

securityAutoMsgSgpolicyWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgSgpolicyWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for Sgpolicy objects

securityAutoMsgTrafficEncryptionPolicyWa.title: AutoMsgTrafficEncryptionPolicyWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for TrafficEncryptionPolicy objects

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of the certificate.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the certificate.

securityCertificate.title: Certificate represents a certificate with associated chain of trust

securityCertificateList.title: CertificateList is a container object for list of Certificate objects

description.title: Description of the purpose of this certificate

usages.description:
Usage can be "client", "server" or "trust-root" in any combination.
A "server" certificate is used by a server to authenticate itself to the client
A "client" certificate is used by a client to authenticate itself to a server
A "trust-root" certificate is self-signed and is only used to validate
certificates presented by peers.
"client" and "server" certificates are always accompanied by a private key,
whereas "trust-root"-only certificates are not.

body.title: Body of the certificate in PEM encoding

trust-chain.description:
Trust chain of the certificate in PEM encoding.
These certificates are treated opaquely. We do not process them in any way
other than decoding them for informational purposes.

validity.description:
Status of the certificate: "valid", "invalid", "expired"
"invalid" means that the signature of the certificate does not match or
there are inconsistencies in the trust chain.

workloads.title: The workloads where this certificate has been deployed

encryption-transform.title: ESP encryption algorithm. Default is "aes-256-gcm-128" (See RFC4106)

integrity-transform.title:
ESP integrity algorithm.
Default is "NULL" (must be "NULL" if AES-GCM is used for encryption)

peer-group.title: Peer group for the rule (from/to group depending on direction)

apps.title: List of Apps to match for the rule

app-user.title:
AppUser or AppUserGroup to match for the rule
AppUser is derived from application payload such as database login or
other application authentication mechanisms
FIXME: oneof does not translate well in golang - will enforce via validation
Used when policy is applied on a single user

app-user-group.title: Used when policy is applied on a group of users

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of the security group.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the security group.

securitySecurityGroup.title: SecurityGroup represents a security zone or domain

securitySecurityGroupList.title: SecurityGroupList is a container object for list of SecurityGroup objects

match-prefixes.title: list of CIDRs that are part of this security group

workloads.title: list of workloads that are part of this security group

Policies.title: list of all policies attached to this security group

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of the sgpolicy.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the sgpolicy.

securitySgpolicy.title: Sgpolicy represents a security policy for security groups

securitySgpolicyList.title: SgpolicyList is a container object for list of Sgpolicy objects

attach-groups.title: list of security groups this policy is attached to

workloads.title: list of workloads in this group

version.title: TLS version: only supported value at present is 1.2

cipher-suite.title:
The name of the cipher suite in IANA format
default is TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of the encryption policy.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the encryption policy.

securityTrafficEncryptionPolicyList.title: TrafficEncryptionPolicyList is a container object for list of TrafficEncryptionPolicy objects

key-rotation-interval-secs.title: How often the keys should be rotated, in seconds
